5 Reasons why your New Year’s resolutions won’t work

by Jake Snow on 01.02.2019

Share

Starting the new year off with a few personal changes in mind always seem logical.

It’s a new year, a new decade, full of infinite opportunities for self-growth and self-development. These changes also go by the name New Year’s Resolutions. Come February, and you’ve probably forgotten about most of them.

Here’s 5 reasons why New Year’s resolutions never survive the first month:

  1. Your resolutions or goals are just to big and unrealistic to achieve
  2. Your resolutions are not actually yours. They are your perception of what you should change based on social media and the influence of other people
  3. You are not motivated or determined enough to follow through on your resolution
  4. You don’t have a practical plan to achieve your resolution
  5. You believe you will fail before you even try
